item.title: U.S. sanctions cyber scammers who stole billions from Americans
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Department of the Treasury has sanctioned several large networks of cyber scam operations in Southeast Asia, which stole over $10 billion from Americans last year. [...]

item.title: Hackers hide behind Tor in exposed Docker API breaches
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A threat actor targeting exposed Docker APIs has updated its malicious tooling with more dangerous functionality that could lay the foundation for a complex botnet. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5065429 update includes 14 changes and fixes
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5065429 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2, with fourteen fixes or changes, including fixes for unexpected UAC prompts and severe lag and stuttering issues with NDI streaming software. [...]

item.title: Microsoft September 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes 81 flaws, two zero-days
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Today is Microsoft's September 2025 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 81 flaws, including two publicly disclosed zero-day vulnerabilities. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5065426 & KB5065431 cumulative updates released
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has released Windows 11 KB5065426 and KB5065431 cumulative updates for versions 24H2 and 23H2 to fix security vulnerabilities and issues. [...]

item.title: Kosovo hacker pleads guilty to running BlackDB cybercrime marketplace
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Kosovo national Liridon Masurica has pleaded guilty to running BlackDB.cc, a cybercrime marketplace that has been active since 2018. [...]

item.title: US charges admin of LockerGoga, MegaCortex, Nefilim ransomware
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice has charged Ukrainian national Volodymyr Viktorovich Tymoshchuk for his role as the administrator of the LockerGoga, MegaCortex, and Nefilim ransomware operations. [...]

item.title: Adobe patches critical SessionReaper flaw in Magento eCommerce platform
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Adobe is warning of a critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-54236) in its Commerce and Magento Open Source platforms that researchers call SessionReaper and describe as one of " the most severe" flaws in the history of the product. [...]

item.title: How External Attack Surface Management helps enterprises manage cyber risk
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Outpost24
item.description: Shadow assets don't care about your perimeter. EASM finds every internet-facing asset, surfaces unknowns, and prioritizes real risks—so you can fix exposures before attackers do. See how Outpost24 makes it easy. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Anti-spam bug blocks links in Exchange Online, Teams
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft is working to resolve a known issue that causes an anti-spam service to mistakenly block Exchange Online and Microsoft Teams users from opening URLs and quarantine some of their emails. [...]

item.title: SAP fixes maximum severity NetWeaver command execution flaw
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SAP has addressed 21 new vulnerabilities affecting its products, including three critical severity issues impacting the NetWeaver software solution. [...]

item.title: Microsoft testing new AI features in Windows 11 File Explorer
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is testing new File Explorer AI-powered features that will enable Windows 11 users to work with images and documents without needing to open the files. [...]

item.title: Plex tells users to reset passwords after new data breach
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Media streaming platform Plex is warning customers to reset passwords after suffering a data breach in which a hacker was able to steal customer authentication data from one of its databases. [...]
